pr_title: Create a MANDATORY Resource instance containing mandatory attributes. Merge that into the default resource.

timeline.bodyText: Think it's good if at least one of the tests has another attribute in it.
timeline.author: anuraaga
anuraaga

replies.bodyText: probably not. Can just use Resource.getEmpty(), for sure.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText:
This is how I initially proposed the spec PR, but not how I reworked it shortly after and how it got approved 😃
Now the spec basically says that we should treat the service.name exactly the same as we already treat the telemetry.sdk.name: It's there by default, but if the user set's their own resource explicitly, they need to merge it in manually.
See open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification#1294 (comment) and https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/39fa82f0a7e58975782520c304768d63da0c7612/specification/resource/sdk.md (not yet merged).
If you think the first version of the PR was better, you should say so on the spec.
@anuraaga @jkwatson You approved the spec PR after I made this change, but maybe you want to check again?
timeline.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: I removed my approval, because I was mostly going on the PR description, which seems to match what I've implemented here. What's now written in the spec is no longer comprehensible to me. :(
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: @jkwatson To really dismiss your approval you have to expand the box at the bottom of the PR and click the dots next to your approval there (or add a request-changes review). Adding a comment-only review does not remove the approval.
replies.author: Oberon00

timeline.message: Add a MANDATORY resource that will contain all mandatory attributes.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this needs to be separated from DEFAULT. Also, this would be the only public field in this class, the others are private and have getters.
timeline.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: I like having it be a separate thing in the code, but agree it should be private, and can be accessed via the default Resource.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: Assign a fallback service name to resources when building the signal Provider instances.
Add a MANDATORY resource that will contain all mandatory attributes.
make the MANDATORY resource instance private
be sure to set the service name in the jaeger tests
